text.headline: Educational Equity Watch
text.text: New York State School Districts labelled Predominantly BIPOC, Predominantly White, and Integrated

media.caption: View from Hook Mountain in Hook Mountain State Park, overlooking the Hudson River, in November 2015

text.headline: Ramapo High School
text.text: Ramapo High School in Rockland county had 294 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as >80% Black & Hispanic school district (98.3% BIPOC, 90.5% Black & Hispanic, 1.7% White). The district is in the 'Urban-Suburban High Needs' Needs to Resource Category (73.8% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 30.3% English Language Learners, 17% students with disabilities, and 7.8% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 86% with 19% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 10%.

media.caption: Geneseo Normal School Front View Geneseo (NY) 1904

text.headline: Geneseo Middle School High School
text.text: Geneseo Middle School High School in Livingston county had 51 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as >80% White school district (9.8% BIPOC, 9.8% Black & Hispanic, 90.2% White). The district is in the 'Average Needs' Needs to Resource Category (33.3% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 2% English Language Learners, 7.8% students with disabilities, and 0% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 98% with 61% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 2%.

text.headline: Penfield Senior High School
text.text: Penfield Senior High School in Monroe county had 330 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as >80% White school district (18.2% BIPOC, 10.9% Black & Hispanic, 81.8% White). The district is in the 'Average Needs' Needs to Resource Category (21.5% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 0.6% English Language Learners, 12.1% students with disabilities, and 0.6% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 98% with 78% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 1%.

text.headline: James Monroe Upper School
text.text: James Monroe Upper School in Monroe county had 158 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as >80% Black & Hispanic school district (96.2% BIPOC, 96.2% Black & Hispanic, 3.8% White). The district is in the 'Buffalo  Rochester  Yonkers  Syracuse' Needs to Resource Category (91.8% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 42.4% English Language Learners, 28.5% students with disabilities, and 1.9% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 74% with 15% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 22%.

media.caption: Brighton High School New York Front

text.headline: Brighton High School
text.text: Brighton High School in Monroe county had 278 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as Integrated school district (32.7% BIPOC, 14.7% Black & Hispanic, 67.3% White). The district is in the 'Low Needs' Needs to Resource Category (23.4% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 0.4% English Language Learners, 9.4% students with disabilities, and 0.7% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 97% with 76% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 1%.

text.headline: Williamsville South High School
text.text: Williamsville South High School in Erie county had 228 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as >80% White school district (19.3% BIPOC, 7% Black & Hispanic, 80.7% White). The district is in the 'Average Needs' Needs to Resource Category (22.8% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 0.4% English Language Learners, 8.8% students with disabilities, and 0% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 95% with 71% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 4%.

media.caption: East High School, Buffalo, New York

text.headline: East Community School
text.text: East Community School in Erie county had 93 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as >80% Black & Hispanic school district (94.6% BIPOC, 88.2% Black & Hispanic, 5.4% White). The district is in the 'Buffalo  Rochester  Yonkers  Syracuse' Needs to Resource Category (80.6% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 9.7% English Language Learners, 18.3% students with disabilities, and 4.3% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 73% with 0% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 20%.

text.headline: South Park High School
text.text: South Park High School in Erie county had 215 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as Integrated school district (65.6% BIPOC, 60.9% Black & Hispanic, 34.4% White). The district is in the 'Buffalo  Rochester  Yonkers  Syracuse' Needs to Resource Category (74.9% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 6.5% English Language Learners, 22.8% students with disabilities, and 0.5% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 81% with 9% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 13%.

text.headline: Leon M. Goldstein High School
text.text: Leon M Goldstein High School For The Sci in Kings county had 239 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as Integrated school district (41% BIPOC, 14.6% Black & Hispanic, 59% White). The district is in the 'NYC' Needs to Resource Category (46.9% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 0.4% English Language Learners, 17.6% students with disabilities, and 0.4% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 97% with 84% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 1%.

text.headline: Millennium Brooklyn High School
text.text: Millennium Brooklyn High School in Kings county had 173 students enrolled in the 2017 cohort. It can be classified as Integrated school district (48% BIPOC, 33.5% Black & Hispanic, 52% White). The district is in the 'NYC' Needs to Resource Category (38.7% of the students in the 2017 cohort were identified as economically disadvantaged). Additional characteristics: 0% English Language Learners, 17.9% students with disabilities, and 0% homeless. The graduation rate within 5 years for the 2017 cohort was 99% with 89% of students receiving an advanced regents. The dropout percentage was 1%.
